column4: you're not.  That's an unfortunate situation you have to deal with
worst case, you could wipe out some of your hidden directories that store gnome settings
usually you install ubuntu-desktop to get gnome
where would I find those hidden directories?
in your user
/home/drew/.gnome?
or .gconf, perhaps
so it's safe to just delete the whole file?
does the keyboard shortcut work (Ctrl-Alt-L) ?
it's a directory, and be aware that it'll delate all kinds of settings
settings that I need to have my computer actually work?
not the system, but evolution is a good example
hopefully you'll get it resolved soon :)
I hope so too.  I always seem to have some problem with these bi-annual upgrades.
haha, compared to winXP this is cake.
no, not at all.  You mean lock the screen?
yes, it won't let me, I click it and nothing happens
nope, neither does my panel shortcut or doing it from the shut down menu
not sure what happened there
yeah, I guess I'm lucky that updates don't completely screw up my computer, but I just get these annoying little idiosyncracies
chennaituxian, farous, that didn't fix it.  Wanna see the error I get when I boot?
